<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation against priuate challenges and combats: vvith articles annexed for the better directions to be vsed therein, and for the more iudiciall proceeding against offenders. England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I) James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
4 p.
by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : anno Dom. 1613 [i.e. 1614].
Dated at end: VVestminster the fourth day of February, in the eleuenth yeere of our reigne .. The publication year is given according to Lady Day dating. Arms 13; Steele notation: and pose 2) doeth 3) bee 4) speedie then. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

4 p.
by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : anno Dom. 1613 [i.e. 1614].
Dated at end: VVestminster the fourth day of February, in the eleuenth yeere of our reigne .. The publication year is given according to Lady Day dating. Arms 13; Steele notation: and pose 2) doeth 3) bee 4) speedie then. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
